tit.e: List of conferrals of posthumous ranks (Zoishokenden)
tit.cmt: 「例言」によれば国友社／田尻 佐編輯『贈位諸賢伝 一・二』（1927年）は、編者が先に刊行した『贈位 諸賢事略』に1200余名を加えた2168名収録の増補版である. http://www.libro-koseisha.co.jp/top03/rb815.html / The same number of 2168 can also be found in 日本史文献解題辞典
tit.e: Zoishokenden (list of conferrals of posthumous ranks)
tit.cmt: In all the headings requiring the use of Japanese that I have seen so far, the Japanese has been provided first, with the definition provided in parentheses, so I have edited this to match that style.
tit.e: Zoishokenden (list of conferrals of posthumous ranks)

sen.j: 『贈位諸賢伝』(ぞういしょけんでん)とは、明治元年(1868年)より同43年(1911年)にかけて贈位された人物、966人の略伝を叙述した文献のことをいう。
sen.e: "Zoishokenden"is the title of a book which lists 966 personalities with a brief biography who were ranked posthumously in the time from 1868 to 1911.
sen.cmt: 田尻 佐 (編集) 出版社: 国友社 (1927) ASIN: B000J9ER1K 発売日： 1927
sen.e: "Zoishokenden" is the title of a book which lists 966 persons who were granted a rank posthumously between 1868 and 1911; a brief biography is provided for each of them.
"Zoishokenden" is the title of a book which lists 966 persons who were granted a rank posthumously between 1868 and 1911; a brief biography is provided for each of them.

sen.j: 学者や政治家、幕末の志士などの掲載が主である。
sen.e: These are mainly scholars, statesmen and patriots from the end of the Edo period.
The people whose names appeared in this book were mainly scholars, statesmen and patriots from the end of the Edo period.
The people whose names appeared in this book were mainly scholars, statesmen and patriots from the end of the Edo period.
